project_config module

class project_config.ProjectConfig(main, verbose=1)[source]

Bases: DataManager

Manage project config, including opening a project and storing paths to all project files

create_new_project(directory)[source]

Creates a new project directory and initializes it with necessary files.

Parameters:

directory (str) – Path to existing project directory to initialize.

Returns:

(success, error_message)

Return type:

tuple

Notes

  • The function creates the following files using templates in the project resources: 1. Config file for the region (if not already present). 2. Color ramp file for rendering. 3. A Makefile if it doesn’t exist in the parent directory.

  • Creates an empty DEM proxy file.

  • The function ensures no existing config or ramp file is overwritten.

file_suffix = {'app_config': 'relief_editor.cfg', 'color_ramp': '_color_ramp.txt', 'config': '_relief.cfg', 'dem': '_DEM_trigger.cfg'}
get_layer()[source]

Get the name for the currently selected layer.

get_proxy_path()[source]

Return path for Config file proxy

get_target_image_name(basename, preview_mode, layer)[source]

Get target image name - <region>_<layer>_<basename>_<prv>.tif :param basename: The basename for the target image (hillshade, relief, etc.) :param preview_mode: True if we are in preview mode.False for normal mode :type preview_mode: bool :param layer: The layer name

Returns:

target image name

Returns:

True on success, False on failure.

verify(file_keys, script_keys, folder_keys)[source]

Verify the presence of required files and scripts and update status accordingly. :returns: True if the files are present, False otherwise. :rtype: bool

project_config.app_files_path(filename)[source]

Determine the platform-appropriate path for app files.

project_config.create_file_from_resource(resource_name, target_path, replace_text=None, new_text=None)[source]

Create a file from a resource template, optionally replacing text.

Parameters:

  • resource_name (str) – The name of the resource to read.

  • target_path (str) – The path where the file should be created.

  • replace_text (str, optional) – The text to be replaced in the resource.

  • new_text (str, optional) – The text to replace replace_text with.

Raises:

  • FileNotFoundError – If the resource cannot be read.

  • FileExistsError – If the target file already exists.

  • Exception – For other unexpected errors.

project_config.script_available(script_name)[source]

Check if a script file is available on the user’s PATH.

Parameters:

script_name (str) – Name of the script file.

Returns:

True if the script is available, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

project_config.touch_file(filename)[source]

Set the file’s modification and access time to the current time.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Path to the file.
